alert.note: Alert for Clay; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 4:54PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Nicholas, east central Kanawha, southern Clay and north central Fayette Counties through 530 PM EST... At 454 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Pratt, or 14 miles east of Charleston, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clay, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Glasgow, Pratt, Glen, Pinch, Bickmore, Swiss, Indore, Bentree, Drennan and Pond Gap. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
